title: Stabilizers of the Distal Radioulnar Joint
summary: Walk through the DRUJ surfaces, then overlay the triangular fibrocartilage complex to show how pronation-supination stays stable.
high_yield: DRUJ is a pivot joint between ulnar head and radial notch—state this before adding soft tissue.
TFCC spans radius to ulna + triquetrum/pisiform, acting as a load-bearing articular disc.
Highlight dorsal vs. volar radioulnar ligaments to tie into instability exams.
pitfalls: Many forget the TFCC also supports the ulnocarpal compartment—include a quick overlay to reinforce.
Avoid suggesting the ulna touches carpal bones directly; emphasize disc interposition.
